## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I have some questions about Verus and its capabilities. How do the fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool work on a new blockchain created with Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
On a new blockchain created with Verus, all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain itself, with no rent or fees going back to the Verus blockchain. This means that the new blockchain has full control over its own fees and revenue streams, with seamless connectivity to the Verus network. Do you have any other questions about this or new blockchains?

**User:**
That makes sense. How do blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches work with Verus, and what happens if the minimum participation levels are not met?

**AI Assistant:**
With Verus, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches can be set up with minimum required levels of worldwide participation in specific currencies on the chain. If the minimum participation levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of their pre-conversions, minus network fees. This ensures that launches are fair and transparent, with built-in safeguards for participants. Does that answer your question?

**User:**
And what are some of the advanced features available for blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches with Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus offers a range of advanced features for blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches, including maximum participation levels in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, vesting schedules for pre-allocations, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. These features provide a high degree of customization and flexibility for launch organizers. Do you have any other questions about this or blockchain-based crowdfunding?

**User:**
Finally, could you explain the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and what are its key benefits?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network is a decentralized network that allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. This network enables the creation of public blockchains available for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains that can be easily set up with bridging of public currencies into an organization's internal network. The key benefits of this network include unlimited scale, seamless connectivity, and decentralized bridge confirmation via Notary IDs. I hope this answers your question! Let me know if you need more information.
How do the fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool work on a new blockchain created with Verus?

On a new blockchain created with Verus, all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain itself, with no rent or fees going back to the Verus blockchain. This means that the new blockchain has full control over its own fees and revenue streams, with seamless connectivity to the Verus network.

in, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network and back, with all features and currencies of the public chain but none of the access. There is no limit on the number of blockchains that may continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network. This network enables the creation of public blockchains available for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains that can be easily set up with bridging of public currencies into an organization's internal network.
